page.title: 05Farming at Weston
page.content: There is mixed farming in the area,the majority of which is arable - mostly wheat,whilst fodder crops such as oil seed rape,maize and grass for silage are also grown to a lesser degree. The rest of the farmland is used for the grazing of sheep,pigs(an outdoor herd) and store cattle.A small amount of dairy farming is carried out but this is declining in the area.One small area of woodland has been planted with conifers as a cash crop.The rest of the woodland is managed for sporting purposes.
